imt: \textsc{1pl.nom} there.\textsc{rem} come.\textsc{pfv"=mpl} when avalanche strike\textsc{-cv} \textsc{1pl.acc} take.away.\textsc{pfv"=mpl}
src: \textbf{be} eetáa yhóol-a ta hiimaál čhinǰ-í \textbf{asaám} híṛ-a
trs: When we came there, an~avalanche hit and swept us away.' (A:ACR012)
We haven't called you.' (A:GHU030)
I was asleep and my wife was also asleep.' (A:HUA015)
I found the bald one.' (A:KAT119)
He said, ``It will eat me up''.' (A:GHA018)
We heard about it.' (A:GHA006)
Nowhere am I safe from you.' (A:PAS126)
And Fazel Noor was my own grandfather.' [Preceded by a~genealogy starting with a~distant forefather.] (B:ATI078)

imt: now \textsc{prox} present time.\textsc{gen} \textsc{1sg.nom} \textsc{ampl} herd-\textsc{obl"=gen} occupation do-\textsc{prs"=msg}
src: típa aní mauǰudá waqt-íi \textbf{ma} \textbf{eé} bakáara-m-ii kasúb th-áan-u
trs: Nowadays I myself am engaged in shepherding.' (A:KEE079)
I myself went halfways.' (A:CAV010)

src: dúu ta \textbf{míi} \textbf{ni} \textbf{eé} ac̣híi-a dúu ba tóoruṇ-a wée
trs: Two were those very eyes of mine, and two were up on my forehead.' (A:HUA114)
He is helping these unbelievers.' (A:BEZ053)
They become brothers.' (A:MIT011)

src: kareé=ɡale \textbf{se} múṛ-im ta, asím  tenaám ḍhanɡéel-im
trs: When they [the woman and her daughter] died, we buried them.'\newline (B:FOR037)
A cupboard can also have different designs.
It can have many different kinds of shelves.' (A:HOW049-50)
[He] said, ``Whose skull is this?''.' (A:WOM459)
They said, ``This one has saved our reputation.''' (A:BEW008)
Then, go ahead and take him away!' (B:ATI066)
This land was like a~forest.' (A:ANC006)
Whose house is that [pointing]?' (B:DHN4839)

imt: \textsc{dist} goat keep.\textsc{pfv-f} \textsc{condh} {} \textsc{3sg.dist.acc} like.this=do.\textsc{cv} keep-\textsc{oblg} \textsc{comp} method by water {} \textsc{3sg.dist.acc} to extra cut.\textsc{pfv"=msg} \textsc{condh} also \textsc{3fsg}.\textsc{dist.nom} spoiled become-\textsc{prs-f}
src: \textbf{eeṛé} \textbf{čhéeli} seetíl-i seentá /{\ldots}/ \textbf{las} eendáa=the saat"=eeṇḍeéu ki tariqá baándi wíi /{\ldots}/ \textbf{las} the beezáaya ṭoḍusóol-u seentá bi \textbf{le} xaraáp bh-éen-i
trs: This goat should be cared for like this{\ldots} She should be given water at the proper time{\ldots} Also, if she is fed too much, it is not good for her.' (A:KEE012-4)

src: ma díi xu \textbf{aṛanaám} mheeríl-a, uɡheeṇíi-a mheeríl-a
trs: They [the people you gave me] were killed, the Pashtuns.' (A:BEZ116-7)\\
Why not let them/these drink water.' (A:PAS070)
Its method is as follows{\ldots}.' (A:KEE024)
These are the benefits of the goat.' (A:KEE065)

imt: then \textsc{def} man-\textsc{obl} to \textsc{dist.msg.nom} story knowledge be.\textsc{pst} \textsc{comp} evil.spirit one shot-\textsc{obl} by \textsc{cntr} die-\textsc{prs"=msg}
src: thée se míiš-a the \textbf{eeṛó} \textbf{qisá} páta de ki bhalaá áa čhaṭ-í baándi ta mar-áan-u
trs: Then the man remembered the saying that an~evil spirit dies by a~single shot.' (A:WOM675)
In our language we call this ``duula'' [appr. proposal of marriage].'\newline (A:MAR026)
Between themselves they made this plan{\ldots}' (A:WOM474)

imt: outside \textsc{top} \textsc{idef} evil.spirit woman=\textsc{cnj} man-\textsc{gen} \textsc{dist.msg.nom} consultation listen-\textsc{3sg} \textsc{pst}
src: dharéndi ba áa bhalaá kúṛi=ee míiš-ii \textbf{eeṛó} \textbf{mašwará} ṣúṇ-a de
trs: Outside an~evil spirit was listening to that plan the wife and husband made.' (A:WOM632)

imt: \textsc{rem} night-\textsc{obl} \textsc{3sg.obl} \textsc{def} corpse to night-\textsc{obl} duty do.\textsc{pfv-f}
src: \textbf{eesé} \textbf{róot-a} tíi se ǰinaazá the róota ḍipṭí thíil-i
trs: That night he held a~vigil for the corpse.' (A:WOM665)

imt: cupboard into \textsc{top} five quarter-\textsc{pl} wood plank thick-\textsc{msg} be.put.\textsc{pfv"=msg} \textsc{condl} \textsc{3msg.rem.nom} much-\textsc{msg} good.\textsc{msg} become-\textsc{prs"=msg}
src: aalmaarí wée ba páanǰ paaw-á ḍhínɡar bhit bhakúl-u laɡaiǰíl-u heentá \textbf{eesó} bíiḍ-u šóo bh-áan-u
trs: If five quarters of wooden planks are put into the cupboard, that will look very beautiful.
Once upon a~time, there was a~man.' (A:THA001)
Meanwhile a~hairy monster came along.' (A:THA005)

imt: monster come.\textsc{cv} inside enter.\textsc{pfv"=msg} \textsc{sub} \textsc{def.msg.nom} man meat eat.\textsc{3sg} \textsc{pst}
src: \textbf{ṭhaaṭáaku} yhaí šíiṭi ačíit-u ta \textbf{so} \textbf{míiš} mhaás khóo de
trs: When the monster came inside, the man was eating.' (A:THA006)

imt: then \textsc{def} monster-\textsc{obl} also \textsc{3sg.acc} with eat.\textsc{vn} start do.\textsc{pfv"=msg}
src: théeba \textbf{se} \textbf{ṭhaaṭáak-a} bi \textbf{tas} sanɡí khainií široó thíil-u
trs: And the monster started eating with him.' (A:THA007)

src: ma bhíiru ɡhin-í \textbf{thíi} ɡhooṣṭ-á the yh-úum
trs: I will come to your house and bring a~he"=goat.' (A:MIT013)
His power was great.' (B:ATI022)

src: se míiš-e kiraamát míi \textbf{teeṇíi} ac̣híi-am drhíṣṭ-i
trs: I saw the man's power with my own eyes.' (B:ATI072)

imt: \textsc{refl} one son Carel \textsc{quot} there throw-\textsc{cv} \textsc{top} go.\textsc{pfv.msg}
src: \textbf{teeṇíi} ak putr kaarél thaní hatáa ɡal-í ba ɡáu
trs: [He] left his son, called Carel, there and left.' (B:ATI010-1)

imt: \textsc{def} spirit \textsc{def} woman to say.\textsc{pfv-msg} \textsc{comp} \textsc{refl} bracelet.\textsc{pl} \textsc{neg} rattle.\textsc{imp.sg}
src: se bhalaá se kúṛi the maníit-u ki \textbf{teeṇíi} banɡleé na širinɡá
trs: The spirit said to the woman, ``Don't rattle your bracelets!''' (A:WOM643)

imt: leopard-\textsc{obl} from this.way=do.\textsc{cv} \textsc{refl} self salvation do.\textsc{pfv-f}
trs: This way he saved himself from the leopard.' (B:CLE381)
If two people would become fond of one another{\ldots}' (A:MIT010)
Their children call one another uncle.' (A:MIT026)

imt: Chitrali-\textsc{pl} \textsc{1pl.acc} to Dangarik call-\textsc{prs"=mpl} some \textsc{top} \textsc{1pl.acc} to Kalasha-\textsc{pl} call-\textsc{prs"=mpl}

trs: The Chitralis call us Dangarik, and some consider us Kalasha.' (A:ANJ015)

imt: \textsc{3sg.obl} water-\textsc{obl} in some thing see.\textsc{pfv"=msg} be.\textsc{prs"=msg}

trs: She has seen something in the water.' (A:SHY053)
